comments:
I have an intro action that delegates to an IIntroAction class via a
http://org.eclipse.ui.intro/runAction link defined in my intro content.

The class is pretty simple. It is intended to read a perspective ID that is
passed in as a parameter of the action, close the intro view, and open the
perspective.

The code to run the action is as follows ...
	/* (non-Javadoc)
	 * @see org.eclipse.jface.action.IAction#run()
	 */
	public void run(IIntroSite site, Properties params) {
		final String perspectiveID = params.getProperty("id");
		if (perspectiveID != null) {
			try {
				// Close the intro view ...
				IIntroURL introURL =
IntroURLFactory.createIntroURL("http://org.eclipse.ui.intro/close");
				if (introURL != null)
					introURL.execute();

				// Open the perspective ...
				IWorkbench wb = PlatformUI.getWorkbench();
				wb.showPerspective(perspectiveID, wb.getActiveWorkbenchWindow());
			} catch (Exception e) { // log err }
		}
	}
}

Note: I believe this worked in M9, but is now broke in RC1. I have tried to
close the view directly through the introManager with the same result. If there
is another way to accomplish this, please let me know.

The resulting stack trace is appended below for reference ...

thomas,
I just tried this in RC2 (I Build id: 200406111814) and it worked. The Intro 
view closed and the Resource perspective came in focus. 
Please reopen if you still have problems.

Note: you should also be able to use the IntroManager APIs, like you 
mentioned. You dont need the Intro URL.
